title: Package Development Notes
text: Contains daily notes details things developed. Primarily following https://r-pkgs.org/.

title: Package Development Notes
text: Spacing examples render better documentation/website Adding function create individual-level readmission risks (predicted expected). global binding issue deal : ’ll carry now. Also, discovered nuances column names reports, headers annoying special characters, need create robust approach specifiying headers (without drastically changing source names).
code: ❯ checking R code for possible problems ... NOTE   hsr_readmission_risks: no visible binding for global variable ‘Value’   hsr_readmission_risks: no visible binding for global variable ‘Factor’   hsr_readmission_risks: no visible binding for global variable ‘Weight’   hsr_readmission_risks: no visible binding for global variable ‘ID     Number’   hsr_readmission_risks: no visible binding for global variable ‘LP’   hsr_readmission_risks: no visible binding for global variable     ‘Predicted’   hsr_readmission_risks: no visible binding for global variable     ‘Expected’   Undefined global functions or variables:     Expected Factor ID Number LP Predicted Value Weight  0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 2 notes ✖

title: Package Development Notes
text: Created function extract dually-eligible stays (hsr_extract_dual_stays). Changing examples use FY2025 mock report.

title: Package Development Notes
text: Added formatted reference index package website. See issue. Added function (hsr_extract_discharges) import discharges specified cohort. Also gives ability keep certain columns (e.g., PHI, risk factors) certain rows (e.g., eligible discharges ).

title: Package Development Notes
text: Created function extract cohort summary (hsr_extract_cohort_summary). See issue

title: Package Development Notes
text: Grouping PDC functions together common .R file documentation (https://github.com/centralstatz/readmit/issues/9) Updated documentation across files better align best practices (https://r-pkgs.org/man.html#roxygen2-basics) Changed hsr_extract_payment_summary function return wide format. Added helper functions (non-exported) consolidate repeated code convenience functions. Used use_import_from("rlang", ".data") resolve global binding issue. hsr_extract_coefficients function, used .data pronoun (dplyr::filter(!.na(.data$Value))) 1 note regarding NEWS.md

title: Package Development Notes
text: Added dependencies well: httr, readr, tibble Added inital tests functions Still notes global bindings
code: hsr_extract_coefficients: no visible binding for global variable     ‘Value’   pdc_datasets: no visible binding for global variable ‘issued’   pdc_datasets: no visible binding for global variable ‘modified’   Undefined global functions or variables:     Value issued modified  0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 2 notes ✖

title: Package Development Notes
text: Added package dependencies readxl, stringr, dplyr, tidyr, rlang use_package() Added unit testing structure use_testthat(); created initial (toy) test use_test("hsr_extract_coefficients") Added README file usethis::use_readme_rmd() built default .md file build_readme() Added NEWS.md use_news_md() Added badges (anticipation): use_cran_badge(), use_coverage(), use_github_action("check-standard") Added logo (created hexmake + ChatGPT): use_logo() Started package website use_pkgdown() pkgdown::build_site() get initial site used usethis::use_pkgdown_github_pages() create GitHub Actions workflow update site commit/push. automatically configures GitHub (branch created Pages configured). need push site pkgdown stuff yet. Made inst/extdata/ directory Went QualityNet downloaded FY 2025 HSR (https://qualitynet.cms.gov/inpatient/hrrp/reports#tab3) (11/8/2025 @ 11:56 CST). Added file directory. suggested (https://r-pkgs.org/data.html#sec-data-example-path-helper) created new helper function hsr_example() help identify file users. use_r("hsr_example"). copied exact function definition (changes reflect current package). Added documentation. Added unit test ensure example file exists user file system. final check(), still one (expected) note (resolve later) ``` ❯ checking package subdirectories … NOTE Problems news ‘NEWS.md’: news entries found. ❯ checking R code possible problems … NOTE hsr_extract_coefficients: visible binding global variable ‘Value’ Undefined global functions variables: Value 0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 2 notes ✖ ❯ checking R code possible problems … NOTE hsr_extract_coefficients: visible binding global variable ‘Value’ Undefined global functions variables: Value 0 errors ✔ | 1 warning ✖ | 1 note ✖ ``` Starting next…
code: * Added all FY mock reports to `extdata`. Used `rename_files("hsr_example", "hsr_mock_reports")` to rename the function to be more explicit. Changed all required areas to accomodate change.  # 11/5/2025  * Initialized package by creating repo here: https://github.com/centralstatz/readmit * Then created _New Folder from Git_ in Positron, cloning that repo * Then used `usethis::create_package(getwd())` to initialize package template * Added this file `DEVNOTES.md` to `.Rbuildignore` * Ran `usethis::use_r("hsr_extract_coefficients")` to create the packages first function, which extracts the list of model coefficients from a CMS Hospital Specific Report (HSR) for a specified cohort. Added argument checks. * Used `devtools::load_all()` to test it (works on locally downloaded report). * Did initial `devtools::check()` and got various warnings/notes, which is expected because nothing was configured yet. * Edited the `DESCRIPTION` file (with possibly to change over time as package evolves), and added MIT license with `usethis::use_mit_license()` * Added `roxygen2` documentation to function. Used `devtools::document()` to document it. Added `\dontrun` to roxygen for function as example doesn't work yet. Need to put external data in the package. * Still have warning/note as I haven't declared dependencies, so will do that soon.

what: Extract risk model coefficients from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_coefficients
title: Extract risk model coefficients from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_coefficients
text: Parses regression coefficients logistic regression model used CMS estimate discharge-level readmission risk, including hospital-level hospital average intercept terms.

code: hsr_extract_coefficients(file, cohort)

title: Extract risk model coefficients from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_coefficients

code: # Access a report my_report <- hsr_mock_reports("FY2025_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx")  # Extract the cohort summary as a dataset hsr_extract_cohort_summary(my_report) #> # A tibble: 6 × 10 #>   `Measure [a]` `Number of Eligible Discharges [b]` Number of Readmissions Amo…¹ #>   <chr>                                       <dbl>                        <dbl> #> 1 AMI                                             2                            0 #> 2 COPD                                           18                            3 #> 3 HF                                             25                            2 #> 4 Pneumonia                                      32                            5 #> 5 CABG                                           NA                           NA #> 6 THA/TKA                                        45                            0 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​`Number of Readmissions Among Eligible Discharges [c]` #> # ℹ 7 more variables: `Predicted Readmission Rate [d]` <dbl>, #> #   `Expected Readmission Rate [e]` <dbl>, #> #   `Excess Readmission Ratio (ERR) [f]` <dbl>, #> #   `Peer Group Median ERR [g]` <dbl>, `Penalty Indicator (Yes/No) [h]` <chr>, #> #   `Ratio of DRG Payments Per Measure to Total Payments [i]` <dbl>, #> #   `National Observed Readmission Rate [j]` <dbl>

what: Extract discharge-level data from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_discharges
title: Extract discharge-level data from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_discharges
text: Parses discharge-level data specific program cohort contributed penalty program reporting fiscal year (FY).

title: Extract discharge-level data from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_discharges
code: hsr_extract_discharges(   file,   cohort,   discharge_phi = TRUE,   risk_factors = FALSE,   eligible_only = FALSE )

title: Extract discharge-level data from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_discharges
text: file File path report cohort Cohort extract discharges . One c("AMI", "COPD", "HF", "PN", "CABG", "HK") discharge_phi discharge PHI included? Defaults TRUE (see details). risk_factors readmission risk factors included? Defaults FALSE (see details). eligible_only eligible discharges included? Defaults FALSE (see details).

title: Extract discharge-level data from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_discharges
text: tibble::tibble()

title: Extract discharge-level data from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_discharges
text: first set columns discharge level data (typically column R) contain protected health information (PHI) associated discharges, medical record identifiers, admission/discharge/readmission dates, index diagnoses, etc. can used identify specific patients contributing (contributing) CMS penalty calculation cohort. risk factors contain discharge-level clinical information used individual risk adjustment CMS estimate individual level readmission rates. can useful explore understand risk factor distributions prevalence, especially combination hsr_extract_coefficients() indicates risk factors heavily-weighted readmission risk calculation. HSR contains discharges necessarily included/eligible counted Hospital Readmissions Reduction Program (HRRP). Setting eligible_only = TRUE filter returned result eligible, thus match denominator displayed hsr_extract_cohort_summary().

title: Extract discharge-level data from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_discharges
code:
# Access a report my_report <- hsr_mock_reports("FY2025_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx")  # All discharges hsr_extract_discharges(my_report, "HF") #> # A tibble: 30 × 17 #>    `ID Number` MBI         `Medical Record Number` `Beneficiary DOB` #>          <int> <chr>       <chr>                   <chr>             #>  1           1 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  2           2 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  3           3 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  4           4 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  5           5 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  6           6 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  7           7 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  8           8 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  9           9 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #> 10          10 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #> # ℹ 20 more rows #> # ℹ 13 more variables: `Admission Date of Index Stay` <chr>, #> #   `Discharge Date of Index Stay` <chr>, #> #   `Cohort Inclusion/Exclusion Indicator` <chr>, `Index Stay (Yes/No)` <chr>, #> #   `Principal Discharge Diagnosis of Index Stay` <chr>, #> #   `Discharge Destination` <chr>, #> #   `Unplanned 
Readmission within 
30 Days (Yes/No) [a]` <chr>, …   # Discharges eligible for HRRP hsr_extract_discharges(my_report, "HF", eligible_only = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 25 × 17 #>    `ID Number` MBI         `Medical Record Number` `Beneficiary DOB` #>          <int> <chr>       <chr>                   <chr>             #>  1           1 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  2           2 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  3           3 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  4           4 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  5           5 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  6           6 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  7           7 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  8           8 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  9           9 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #> 10          10 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #> # ℹ 15 more rows #> # ℹ 13 more variables: `Admission Date of Index Stay` <chr>, #> #   `Discharge Date of Index Stay` <chr>, #> #   `Cohort Inclusion/Exclusion Indicator` <chr>, `Index Stay (Yes/No)` <chr>, #> #   `Principal Discharge Diagnosis of Index Stay` <chr>, #> #   `Discharge Destination` <chr>, #> #   `Unplanned 
Readmission within 
30 Days (Yes/No) [a]` <chr>, …   # Only show risk factors for eligible discharges hsr_extract_discharges(    file = my_report,    cohort = "HF",    discharge_phi = FALSE,    risk_factors = TRUE,    eligible_only = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 25 × 39 #>    `ID Number` `Years Over 65 (continuous)`  Male History of Coronary Artery B…¹ #>          <int>                        <dbl> <dbl>                          <dbl> #>  1           1                            8     1                              0 #>  2           2                           25     1                              1 #>  3           3                            9     0                              0 #>  4           4                            9     0                              0 #>  5           5                           30     0                              0 #>  6           6                           13     0                              0 #>  7           7                           12     1                              1 #>  8           8                            7     1                              1 #>  9           9                           25     1                              0 #> 10          10                           22     0                              0 #> # ℹ 15 more rows #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​`History of Coronary Artery Bypass Graft (CABG) Surgery` #> # ℹ 35 more variables: `History of COVID-19` <dbl>, #> #   `Metastatic Cancer and Acute Leukemia` <dbl>, Cancer <dbl>, #> #   `Diabetes Mellitus (DM) or DM Complications` <dbl>, #> #   `Protein-Calorie Malnutrition` <dbl>, #> #   `Other Significant Endocrine and Metabolic Disorders; Disorders of Fluid/Electrolyte/
Acid-base Balance` <dbl>, …  # Row count matches denominator for HF hsr_extract_cohort_summary(my_report) #> # A tibble: 6 × 10 #>   `Measure [a]` `Number of Eligible Discharges [b]` Number of Readmissions Amo…¹ #>   <chr>                                       <dbl>                        <dbl> #> 1 AMI                                             2                            0 #> 2 COPD                                           18                            3 #> 3 HF                                             25                            2 #> 4 Pneumonia                                      32                            5 #> 5 CABG                                           NA                           NA #> 6 THA/TKA                                        45                            0 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​`Number of Readmissions Among Eligible Discharges [c]` #> # ℹ 7 more variables: `Predicted Readmission Rate [d]` <dbl>, #> #   `Expected Readmission Rate [e]` <dbl>, #> #   `Excess Readmission Ratio (ERR) [f]` <dbl>, #> #   `Peer Group Median ERR [g]` <dbl>, `Penalty Indicator (Yes/No) [h]` <chr>, #> #   `Ratio of DRG Payments Per Measure to Total Payments [i]` <dbl>, #> #   `National Observed Readmission Rate [j]` <dbl>

text: tibble::tibble()

title: Extract dually-eligible discharges from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_dual_stays
text: Hospital Readmissions Reduction Program (HRRP), hospitals' readmission rates compared peer group "like" hospitals, determines whether get penalized financially. peer group allocation done CMS determined creating hospital groupings based share Medicare beneficiaries also eligible Medicaid benefits, marker socioeconomic status hospital population. hsr_extract_dual_stays() extracts list discharges accounting numerator ratio.

code: hsr_extract_payment_summary(file)  hsr_count_dual_eligible_stays(file)  hsr_count_total_stays(file)  hsr_dual_proportion(file)  hsr_peer_group(file)  hsr_neutrality_modifier(file)  hsr_payment_adjustment_factor(file)  hsr_payment_penalty(file)

code: # Access a report my_report <- hsr_mock_reports("FY2025_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx")  # Full payment summary table payment_summary <- hsr_extract_payment_summary(my_report) payment_summary #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   Number of Dually Eligible Stays…¹ Total Number of Stay…² `Dual Proportion [c]` #>                               <dbl>                  <dbl>                 <dbl> #> 1                               186                    856                 0.217 #> # ℹ abbreviated names: ¹​`Number of Dually Eligible Stays (Numerator) [a]`, #> #   ²​`Total Number of Stays(Denominator) [b]` #> # ℹ 4 more variables: `Peer Group Assignment [d]` <dbl>, #> #   `Neutrality Modifier [e]` <dbl>, `Payment Reduction Percentage [f]` <dbl>, #> #   `Payment Adjustment Factor [g]` <dbl>   # Extract individual components (from file) hsr_payment_penalty(my_report) #> [1] 7e-04  # Or existing extract hsr_payment_penalty(payment_summary) #> [1] 7e-04

what: Retrieve file location of mock Hospital-Specific Reports (HSR) — hsr_mock_reports
title: Retrieve file location of mock Hospital-Specific Reports (HSR) — hsr_mock_reports
text: Provides location mock HSRs downloaded QualityNet come package users can import. files representation hospital's real report looks like received CMS. contain mock data sensitive fields (discharge level data, etc.), real data national level results (e.g., model coefficients). Thus, gives user ability practice/explore package functions translate hospital reports. Files include fiscal years (FY) 2019-2025 downloaded 11/8/2025 https://qualitynet.cms.gov/inpatient/hrrp/reports. File names changed better identifiability.

what: Compute discharge-level readmission risks in a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_readmission_risks
title: Compute discharge-level readmission risks in a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_readmission_risks
text: Computes predicted expected readmission risks eligible discharge specified cohort.

title: Compute discharge-level readmission risks in a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_readmission_risks
code: hsr_readmission_risks(file, cohort)

title: Compute discharge-level readmission risks in a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_readmission_risks
text: file File path report cohort Cohort compute readmission risks . One c("AMI", "COPD", "HF", "PN", "CABG", "HK")

title: Compute discharge-level readmission risks in a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_readmission_risks
text: tibble::tibble() containing following columns: ID Number: unique discharge identifier (see hsr_extract_discharges()) Predicted: predicted readmission risk discharge Expected: expected readmission risk discharge

title: Compute discharge-level readmission risks in a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_readmission_risks
text: readmission measure CMS uses grade performance Hospital Readmissions Reduction Program (HRRP). Individual discharges assigned adjusted readmission risk (based clinical history), get aggregated hospital-level score compared peer groups penalty determination. Specifically, random-intercept logistic regression model built cohort (see methodology) serves basis two (2) readmission risks assigned discharge: Predicted: Adjusted patient-specific clinical factors plus hospital-specific effect (random intercept term) Expected: Adjusted patient-specific clinical factors plus hospital-average effect quantities aggregated across discharges ratio taken form Excess Readmission Ratio (ERR), used cohort-specific comparison metric. Thus, comparative measure likely patients readmitted hospital versus average hospital, given hospital's clinical characteristics.

title: Compute discharge-level readmission risks in a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_readmission_risks
code: # Access a report my_report <- hsr_mock_reports("FY2025_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx")  # Compute readmission risks for HF discharges hf_risks <- hsr_readmission_risks(my_report, "HF") hf_risks #> # A tibble: 25 × 3 #>    `ID Number` Predicted Expected #>          <int>     <dbl>    <dbl> #>  1           1    0.258    0.264  #>  2           2    0.186    0.192  #>  3           3    0.184    0.189  #>  4           4    0.188    0.193  #>  5           5    0.0857   0.0885 #>  6           6    0.133    0.138  #>  7           7    0.110    0.113  #>  8           8    0.183    0.188  #>  9           9    0.163    0.168  #> 10          10    0.179    0.184  #> # ℹ 15 more rows  # Compute the ERR from scratch hf_risks |>  dplyr::summarize(    Discharges = dplyr::n(),    Predicted = mean(Predicted),    Expected = mean(Expected),    ERR = Predicted / Expected  ) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   Discharges Predicted Expected   ERR #>        <int>     <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl> #> 1         25     0.159    0.164 0.971   # Check that this matches the report table hsr_extract_cohort_summary(my_report) |>  dplyr::select(   dplyr::matches(      paste0(        "^Measure|",        "^Number of Eligible Discharges|",        "^Predicted|",        "^Expected|",        "^Excess"      )    )  ) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   `Measure [a]` `Number of Eligible Discharges [b]` Predicted Readmission Rate…¹ #>   <chr>                                       <dbl>                        <dbl> #> 1 AMI                                             2                       0.181  #> 2 COPD                                           18                       0.165  #> 3 HF                                             25                       0.159  #> 4 Pneumonia                                      32                       0.142  #> 5 CABG                                           NA                      NA      #> 6 THA/TKA                                        45                       0.0350 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​`Predicted Readmission Rate [d]` #> # ℹ 2 more variables: `Expected Readmission Rate [e]` <dbl>, #> #   `Excess Readmission Ratio (ERR) [f]` <dbl>

what: Import datasets from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
title: Import datasets from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
text: Explore import datasets directly CMS Provider Data Catalog (PDC). pdc_topics(): Retrieves list topics (subcategories) data available pdc_datasets(): Retrieves identifiers, names, descriptions, metadata associated datasets (optionally specified) topics pdc_read(): Imports full dataset given identifier (datasetid). found pdc_datasets().

title: Import datasets from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
code: pdc_read(datasetid, ...)  pdc_datasets(topics = NULL)  pdc_topics()

title: Import datasets from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
text: datasetid dataset identifier (e.g., pdc_datasets()) ... Additional arguments passed readr::read_csv() topics topic list dataset metadata (e.g., pdc_topics())

title: Import datasets from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
text: character vector listing available data topics, tibble::tibble() containing requested data/metadata.

title: Import datasets from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
code: # 1. See list of available data topics pdc_topics() #>  [1] "Dialysis facilities"                    #>  [2] "Doctors and clinicians"                 #>  [3] "Home health services"                   #>  [4] "Hospice care"                           #>  [5] "Hospitals"                              #>  [6] "Inpatient rehabilitation facilities"    #>  [7] "Long-term care hospitals"               #>  [8] "Nursing homes including rehab services" #>  [9] "Physician office visit costs"           #> [10] "Supplier directory"                       # 2. See list of datasets available for a topic hospital_data <- pdc_datasets("Hospitals") hospital_data #> # A tibble: 67 × 7 #>    datasetid topic     title       description issued     modified   downloadurl #>    <chr>     <chr>     <chr>       <chr>       <date>     <date>     <chr>       #>  1 wue8-3vwe Hospitals Ambulatory… This file … 2025-07-16 2025-06-27 https://da… #>  2 4jcv-atw7 Hospitals Ambulatory… A list of … 2025-07-16 2025-06-27 https://da… #>  3 axe7-s95e Hospitals Ambulatory… This file … 2025-07-16 2025-06-27 https://da… #>  4 hbf-map   Hospitals Birthing F… A list of … 2025-07-09 2025-07-16 https://da… #>  5 muwa-iene Hospitals CMS Medica… This data … 2020-12-10 2025-07-16 https://da… #>  6 ynj2-r877 Hospitals Complicati… Complicati… 2023-07-05 2025-07-16 https://da… #>  7 qqw3-t4ie Hospitals Complicati… Complicati… 2020-12-10 2025-07-16 https://da… #>  8 bs2r-24vh Hospitals Complicati… Complicati… 2020-12-10 2025-07-16 https://da… #>  9 z8ax-x9j1 Hospitals Complicati… Prospectiv… 2024-07-31 2025-07-16 https://da… #> 10 jfnd-nl7s Hospitals Complicati… Prospectiv… 2024-07-31 2025-07-16 https://da… #> # ℹ 57 more rows  # Find a dataset you want hospital_data |>    dplyr::filter(       stringr::str_detect(          title,          pattern = "(?i)readmission"       )    ) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   datasetid topic     title        description issued     modified   downloadurl #>   <chr>     <chr>     <chr>        <chr>       <date>     <date>     <chr>       #> 1 9n3s-kdb3 Hospitals Hospital Re… In October… 2020-12-10 2025-01-08 https://da…   # 3. Use that data set ID to import pdc_read("9n3s-kdb3") #> Rows: 18510 Columns: 12 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> chr (11): Facility Name, Facility ID, State, Measure Name, Number of Dischar... #> dbl  (1): Footnote #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. #> # A tibble: 18,510 × 12 #>    `Facility Name`     `Facility ID` State `Measure Name` `Number of Discharges` #>    <chr>               <chr>         <chr> <chr>          <chr>                  #>  1 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-AMI-… 296                    #>  2 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-CABG… 151                    #>  3 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-HF-H… 681                    #>  4 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-HIP-… N/A                    #>  5 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-PN-H… 490                    #>  6 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-COPD… 130                    #>  7 MARSHALL MEDICAL C… 010005        AL    READM-30-CABG… N/A                    #>  8 MARSHALL MEDICAL C… 010005        AL    READM-30-HIP-… N/A                    #>  9 MARSHALL MEDICAL C… 010005        AL    READM-30-HF-H… 176                    #> 10 MARSHALL MEDICAL C… 010005        AL    READM-30-PN-H… 305                    #> # ℹ 18,500 more rows #> # ℹ 7 more variables: Footnote <dbl>, `Excess Readmission Ratio` <chr>, #> #   `Predicted Readmission Rate` <chr>, `Expected Readmission Rate` <chr>, #> #   `Number of Readmissions` <chr>, `Start Date` <chr>, `End Date` <chr>

what: readmit: Tools for navigating, managing, and analyzing hospital readmissions — readmit-package
title: readmit: Tools for navigating, managing, and analyzing hospital readmissions — readmit-package
text: Contains toolkits datasets make managing hospital readmissions easier transparent. Particular context given Hospital Readmissions Reduction Program (HRRP) Center Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) understanding program details analyzing reports.

title: readmit: Tools for navigating, managing, and analyzing hospital readmissions — readmit-package
text: Maintainer: Alex Zajichek alex@centralstatz.com

title: readmit (development version)
text: Initial CRAN submission.
